text:
Raskolnikov climbed the stairs slowly. He hesitated. 

“Should I go?” he thought. 

But he pressed on. 

His clothes were torn and dirty. Rain-soaked, he felt exhausted. 

He knocked. 

Pulcheria Alexandrovna opened the door. 

“Rodya!” she exclaimed, pulling him inside. 

“Don’t be angry,” she said, tears in her eyes. 

“I’m not crying, just happy.” 

He stood there, feeling lost yet determined.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, despite his disheveled appearance and inner turmoil, decides to visit his mother and sister, who are unaware of his struggles.
